ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Hospital admission date
Weight of participant at admission in (lbs)
Reason for Hospitalization
Specify reason for Hospitalization
Hospital discharge date
Weight of participant at discharge (in lbs)
Total days hospitalized
Discharge medications
Please list any types and durations of therapies participant received while hospitalized
Did the subject/patient receive blood products?
Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score at the time of blood collection
Notes: Higher score indicates higher severity of disease

ElementDescription: APACHE II Score at the time of blood collection
Notes: Higher score indicates higher severity of disease

ElementDescription: Outcome of subject/patient post-hospitalization
Notes: 1=Discharged to home; 2=Discharged to skilled nursing facility (SNF) or long-term acute care (LTAC); 3=Deceased

ElementDescription: Location of the subject/patient within the hospital
Enrollment sepsis diagnosis
Site of infection responsible for sepsis
Notes: 1=Lung; 2=Urinary tract; 3=GI tract; 4=Peritonitis; 5=Skin and soft tissue; 6=Heart, endocarditis; 7=Liver abscess; 8=Unknown; 9=Bacteremia; 10= Pancreas; 11=Cholecystitis; 12=Bone and joints; 13=Intraabdominal abscess; 14=Ascending cholangitis

ElementDescription: Were glucocorticoids given to the subject/patient?
Number of days admitted to ICU
Number of days of hospital stay
Number of days on ventilator
